definition: lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
waist/lower back/pocket/middle/loins
to wind around/to wrap round/to coil/tangle/to involve/to bother/to annoy
surname Wan
ten thousand/a great number
see 万俟[Mo4 qi2]
to pierce through/to pass through/to be stringed together/string of 1000 cash

sentences.english: He went away a beggar, returned a millionaire.
sentences.chinese: 他讨吃要饭离家，腰缠万贯回归。

sentences.english: Old Mr. Wilson is lousy with money. He must have possessed some sort of alchemy.
sentences.chinese: 韦尔逊老先生尹腰缠万贯，他准是掌握了什么点金术。

sentences.english: It is ludicrous to imagine that foreigners are just easy marks with fat purses.
sentences.chinese: 只把外国人看成腰缠万贯的简单形象是荒谬的。

sentences.english: And if you believe you’ll never be rich, guess what?
sentences.chinese: 如果你认为你永远不会变得腰缠万贯，你猜怎么着？

definition: affluent/very rich
very rich/millionaire
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
riches and honor
vast wealth
to get rich
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
not having to worry about clothes and food (idiom)/to be provided with the basic necessities
to make easy money/to make a fortune/to line one's pockets
having wealth equivalent to that of an entire nation (idiom)/extremely wealthy
lit. pile up gold and jade/very rich
to get rich quick
both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
rich person/millionaire/billionaire
to be successful in business/professional success
richly bedecked/dripping with gold and silver (idiom)
